frameworks.openingRemark: Node.js is the first and foremost tool to install.

highlights.description: Node.js handles the installation of open source applications through NPM (Node Package Manager), the package manager for the Node.js server platform.

Node functions as a warehouse of third-party applications, while NPM not only delivers the packages but installs the code and manages the code dependencies. All 'node_module' installations are run through the Terminal command line.

steps.list-step: 2. Click the install button and follow the directions
3. Make sure the package is installed into /usr/local/bin

frameworks.openingRemark: Yeoman scaffolds high quality working web applications. Most projects made by the development team are first scaffolded with Yeoman, so browse through the Yeoman generators first for an existing project scaffold before building your own from scratch.

highlights.description: Yeoman combines several functions, e.g. creating a starter template, managing dependencies, and providing a local development server. AngularJS, Assemble, Backbone are just a few examples of project structures that can be instantiated with Yeoman.

frameworks.closingRemarks: Grunt and Bower are components of Yeoman, no extra installation is needed. When Yo creates a project, a 'Gruntfile.js' and 'bower_components.json' are created in the root directory.

frameworks.openingRemark: Sass is a stable, powerful CSS extension, which harbors benefits like allowing functionality available in Object Oriented languages.

highlights.description: Sass supports CSS variable declaration, nesting, mixins, arguments, and selector inheritance. Note: 'gem' is a Ruby declaration.

steps.list-step: 2. If you get an error message, then use the sudo command to install the Sass gem

steps.list-step-helper: The terminal should print out Sass 3.4.13

frameworks.openingRemark: Handlebars builds semantic web page templates.

highlights.description: Handlebars.js is compatible with Mustache.js, but can handle extensibility and minimal logic with '#if', '#unless', '#with', and '#each' helpers.

steps.list-step-helper: Handlebars does not provide a global installation, but can be downloaded from handlebars.com or be installed through Bower.
The files will need to be added to the scripts folder in the project manually.
For Bower install, open the Terminal

frameworks.closingRemarks: If you created an Assemble project, Handlebars files have already been imported.
